content.1: Woe to them that go down to Egypt for help; and stay on horses, and trust in chariots, because

content.7: For in that day every man shall cast away his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which your own hands have made unto you
content.8: Then shall the Assyrian fall with the sword, not of a mighty man; and the sword, not of a mean man, shall devour him: but he shall flee from the sword, and his young men shall be discomfited.
content.9: And he shall pass over to his strong hold for fear, and his princes shall be afraid of the ensign, saith the
